{"step_by_step_thinking": "Serum electrolyte measurement requires a sample that is not contaminated by the anticoagulant used. EDTA, Sodium fluoride, and Citrate are known to interfere with electrolyte measurements. Lithium heparin, on the other hand, is a suitable anticoagulant for electrolyte measurements as it does not interfere with the assay.", "answer_choice": "B. Lithium heparin"}
